EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Copper Cable Factory at position (2.5, 17.5)
Consists of:
– Input Chest at (2.5, 17.5)
– Burner Inserter (direction DOWN) at (1.5, 17.5)
– Burner Inserter (direction UP) at (2.5, 16.5)
– Burner Inserter (direction RIGHT) at (3.5, 17.5)
– Assembling Machine at (1.5, 19.5)
– Output Chest at (1.5, 21.5)
– Burner Inserter (direction UP) at (0.5, 21.5)
Use-case: Links raw material input with assembly to produce copper cable.

### Extraction Depot at position (3.5, 15.5)
Consists of:
– Wooden Chest serving as a belt depot at (3.5, 15.5)
– Dedicated Transport Belt Segment at (4.5, 15.5)
– Depot Burner Inserter (placed adjacent and facing UP) at (3.5, 14.5)
Use-case: Acts as an isolated belt depot receiving items from the extraction system for distribution.

### Extraction System Interface at position (–3.5, 27.5)
Consists of:
– Extraction System Burner Inserter at (–3.5, 27.5) with drop position (–3.5, 28.5)
– Wooden Chest at (–3.5, 26.5)
Use-case: Serves as the connection point to deliver raw materials from extraction operations.

### Electricity Generation Plant spanning positions (–7.5, 25.5) to (–0.5, 24.5)
Consists of:
– Offshore Pump at (–7.5, 25.5)
– Boiler at (–5.5, 24.0)
– Steam Engine (Generator) at (–0.5, 24.5)
Use-case: Generates electrical power through the combined action of pump, boiler, and generator.

### Iron Plate Smelter at position (–3.0, 19.0)
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace at (–3.0, 19.0) (producing iron plates)
Use-case: Smelts ore to produce iron plates.

### Copper Plate Smelter at position (–4.0, 21.0)
Consists of:
– Stone Furnace at (–4.0, 21.0) (producing copper plates)
– Wooden Chest at (–5.5, 21.5) for output storage
Use-case: Smelts ore to produce copper plates.

### Lab (Research Facility) [electrical_id: 7106]
Consists of:
– Lab with input {automation‐science‐pack: 17}
Use-case: Supports research activities (currently not receiving power).

ERROR TIPS

– Belt Connection Targets:
 • When connecting a transport belt, do not use a steam engine as the direct target. Always add an inserter to serve as the input for the steam engine.

– Placement Distance:
 • Ensure that the player has moved within the maximum placement distance before attempting to place an entity; otherwise the target position may be too far.

– Undefined Variables:
 • Verify that all target entities are defined (for example, use correct variable names instead of undefined ones) to prevent name errors.

– Inventory Shortage:
 • Check that the required items (such as wooden chests) are available in the inventory prior to placement attempts.
